text:
[Janaka sends messengers to fetch his brother Kusadhwaja -- at the request of Dasaratha Vasishta narrates the greatness of Ikshvaku dynasty.]

तत: प्रभाते जनक: कृतकर्मा महर्षिभि:।

उवाच वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञ श्शतानन्दं पुरोहितम्।।1.70.1।।
meaning: तत: thereafter, प्रभाते at dawn, महर्षिभि: by maharshis, कृतकर्मा having performed daily (sacrificial) acts, वाक्यज्ञ: conversant in speech, जनक: Janaka, पुरोहितम् chief priest, शतानन्दम् Satananda, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.
translation: Thereafter at dawn after the maharshis had performed their daily (sacrificial) rites the eloquent Janaka said to the chief priest Satananda:

text:
भ्राता मम महातेजा यवीयानतिधार्मिक:।

कुशध्वज इति ख्यात: पुरीमध्यवसच्छुभाम्।।1.70.2।।

वार्याफलकपर्यन्तां पिबन्निक्षुमतीं नदीम्।

साङ्काश्यां पुण्यसङ्काशां विमानमिव पुष्पकम्।।1.70.3।।
meaning: अतिधार्मिक: extremely righteous, कुशध्वज: इति named Kusadhwaja, ख्यात: renowned, महातेजा: most brilliant, मम my, यवीयान् younger, भ्राता brother, इक्षुमतीम् named Ikshumati, नदीम् river, पिबन् drinking, वार्याफलकपर्यन्ताम् darts planted in water as boundary, शुभाम् auspicious, पुण्यसङ्काशाम् sacred, साङ्काश्यां पुरीम् named Sankasya, पुष्पकम् Pushpaka, विमानमिव like chariot, अध्यवसत् is residing.
translation: "The extremely righteous, renowned and most brilliant Kusadhwaja, my younger brother is (at present) ruling the sacred kingdom of Sankasya, which is like the aerial chariot Pushpaka, with darts planted in water as boundary on the bank of the auspicious, sacred river Ikshumati.

text:
भ्राता मम महातेजा यवीयानतिधार्मिक:।

कुशध्वज इति ख्यात: पुरीमध्यवसच्छुभाम्।।1.70.2।।

वार्याफलकपर्यन्तां पिबन्निक्षुमतीं नदीम्।

साङ्काश्यां पुण्यसङ्काशां विमानमिव पुष्पकम्।।1.70.3।।
meaning: अतिधार्मिक: extremely righteous, कुशध्वज: इति named Kusadhwaja, ख्यात: renowned, महातेजा: most brilliant, मम my, यवीयान् younger, भ्राता brother, इक्षुमतीम् named Ikshumati, नदीम् river, पिबन् drinking, वार्याफलकपर्यन्ताम् darts planted in water as boundary, शुभाम् auspicious, पुण्यसङ्काशाम् sacred, साङ्काश्यां पुरीम् named Sankasya, पुष्पकम् Pushpaka, विमानमिव like chariot, अध्यवसत् is residing.
translation: "The extremely righteous, renowned and most brilliant Kusadhwaja, my younger brother is (at present) ruling the sacred kingdom of Sankasya, which is like the aerial chariot Pushpaka, with darts planted in water as boundary on the bank of the auspicious, sacred river Ikshumati.

text:
तमहं द्रष्टुमिच्छामि यज्ञगोप्ता स मे मत:।

प्रीतिं सोऽपि महातेजा इमां भोक्ता मया सह।।1.70.4।।
meaning: अहम् I, तम् him, द्रष्टुम् to behold, इच्छामि I am desiring, स: he, मे my, यज्ञगोप्ता protector of the sacrifice, मत: has been accepted, महातेजा: most glorious, सोऽपि he also, मया सह with me, इमाम् this, प्रीतिम् pleasure, भोक्ता will enjoy.
translation: I desire to see Kusadhwaja who I have accepted as the protector of the sacrifice. I want that my glorious brother should share this pleasure, with me".

text:
एवमुक्ते तु वचने शतानन्दस्य सन्निधौ।

आगता: केचिदव्यग्रा जनकस्तान् समादिशत्।।1.70.5।।
meaning: शतानन्दस्य Satananda's, सन्निधौ in the presence, एवम् thus, वचने words, उक्ते (सति) when he uttered, अव्यग्रा: undistracted, केचित् some (attendants), आगता: had come, जनक: Janaka, तान् them, समादिशत् commanded.
translation: Janaka having said so in the presence of Satananda gave instructions to a few faithful attendants who were present.

text:
शासनात्तु नरेन्द्रस्य प्रययुश्शीघ्रवाजिभि:।

समानेतुं नरव्याघ्रं विष्णुमिन्द्राज्ञया यथा।।1.70.6।।
meaning: नरेन्द्रस्य king Janaka's, शासनात् by the command, इन्द्राज्ञया by the order of Indra, विष्णुं यथा like Visnu, नरव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, समानेतुम् to bring him, शीघ्रवाजिभि: on swift moving steeds, प्रययु: rode away.
translation: In obedience to the command of Indra among men (king Janaka), the messengers rode away on swift horses to bring king Kusadhwaja, a tiger among men just like fetching Visnu by the orders of Indra.

text:
साङ्काश्यां ते समागत्य ददृशुश्च कुशध्वजम्।

न्यवेदयन्यथावृत्तं जनकस्य च चिन्तितम्।।1.70.7।।
meaning: ते those messengers, साङ्काश्याम् city of Sankasya, समागम्य having reached, कुशध्वजम् Kusadhwaja, ददृशुश्च beheld him, यथावृत्तम् as happened, जनकस्य Janaka's, चिन्तितम् intention, न्यवेदयन् च informed.
translation: The messengers reached Sankasya, met Kusadhwaja and related to him what had happened. They informed him the intention of (king) Janaka.

text:
तद्वृत्तं नृपति श्शृत्वा दूतश्रेष्ठैर्महाबलै:।

अज्ञायाऽथ नरेन्द्रस्य आजगाम कुशध्वज:।।1.70.8।।
meaning: नृपति king, कुशध्वज: Kusadhwaja, महाबलै: by men endowed with strength, दूतश्रेष्ठै: by the loyal messengers, तत् that, वृत्तम् events, श्रुत्वा having learned, अथ thereafter, नरेन्द्रस्य king's, आज्ञया by order, आजगाम set out.
translation: Kusadhwaja having heard the events from the loyal, mighty messengers set out for Mithila in compliance with the request of the king (Janaka).

text:
स ददर्श महात्मानं जनकं धर्मवत्सलम्।

सोऽभिवाद्य शतानन्दं राजानं चापि धार्मिकम्।।1.70.9।।

राजार्हं परमं दिव्यमासनं चाऽध्यरोहत।
meaning: स: he, धर्मवत्सलम् devoted to righteousness, महात्मानम् magnanimous, जनकम् Janaka, ददर्श beheld, स: he, शतानन्दम् Satananda, धार्मिकम् virtuous, राजानं च king also, अभिवाद्य having saluted with reverence, राजार्हम् befitting a king, परमम् great, दिव्यम् excellent, आसनम् seat, अध्यरोहत occupied.
translation:
There he saw the highsouled Janaka devoted to righteousness. Having paid his regards to Satananda and the virtuous king he occupied an exalted seat befitting a
king.

text:
उपविष्टावुभौ तौ तु भ्रातरावतितेजसौ।।1.70.10।।

प्रेषयामासतुर्वीरौ मन्त्रिश्रेष्ठं सुदामनम्।
meaning: अतितेजसौ possessing great splendour, तौ वीरौ those two heores, उभौ both, भ्रातरौ brothers, उपविष्टौ seated, मन्त्रिश्रेष्ठम् wisest of ministers, सुदामनम् Sudaman, प्रेषयामासतु: despatched.
translation: The two heroic brothers endowed with great splendour seated beside each other, despatched Sudamana the wisest of ministers (to Dasaratha).

text:
गच्छ मन्त्रिपते शीघ्रमैक्ष्वाकुममितप्रभम्।।1.70.11।।

आत्मजैस्सह दुर्धर्षमानयस्व समन्त्रिणम्।
meaning: मन्त्रिपते O Foremost of counsellors, शीघ्रम् speedily, गच्छ go, अमितप्रभम् immeasurable splendour, ऐक्ष्वाकुम् Ikshvaku king Dasaratha, दुर्धर्षम् invincible, समन्त्रिणम् together with ministers, आत्मजै: along with sons, समानयस्व bring him.
translation: "O Foremost among counsellors, go speedily and bring along with his ministers and sons the invincible Dasaratha of the Ikshvakus dynasty whose splendour is immeasurable".

text:
औपकार्यां स गत्वा तु रघूणां कुलवर्धनम्।।1.70.12।।

ददर्श शिरसा चैनमभिवाद्येदमब्रवीत्।
meaning: स: he, औपकार्याम् tent, गत्वा having gone, रघूणाम् of the race of Raghus, कुलवर्धनम् perpetuating, ददर्श saw, एनम् him, शिरसा bowing down his head, अभिवाद्य having saluted him, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
translation:
Having reached the tent, he (Sudamana) saw Dasaratha, perpetuator of the race of the
Raghus and bowing down his head, said:

text:
अयोध्याधिपते वीर वैदेहो मिथिलाधिप:।।1.70.13।।

स त्वां द्रष्टुं व्यवसितस्सोपाध्यायपुरोहितम्।
meaning: वीर O Heroic one, अयोध्याधिपते O Lord of Ayodhya, मिथिलाधिप: lord of Mithila, वैदेह: Janaka, सोपाध्यायपुरोहितम् along with spiritual preceptors and chief priest, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to see, सः he, व्यवसित: has decided.
translation: "O Heroic lord of Ayodhya, Janaka, the lord of Mithila desires to see you along with preceptors and priest".

text:
मंत्रिश्रेष्ठवच श्शृत्वा राजा सर्षिगणस्तदा।।1.70.14।।

सबंधुरगमत्तत्र जनको यत्र वर्तते।
meaning: तदा then, राजा king, मंत्रिश्रेष्ठवच: the words of the best of counsellors, श्रुत्वा having listened, सर्षिगण: with hosts of rishis, सबंधु: with relations, जनक: Janaka, यत्र where, वर्तते was waiting, तत्र there, अगमत् went.
translation:
King Dasaratha on hearing the words of the best of the counsellors reached the place
where Janaka was waiting with hosts of rishis and relations.

text:
स राजा मन्त्रिसहित स्सोपाध्याय: सबान्धव:।।1.70.15।।

वाक्यं वाक्यविदां श्रेष्ठो वैदेहमिदमब्रवीत्।
meaning: मन्त्रिसहित: along with counsellors, सबान्धव: with relations, स: king Dasaratha, वाक्यविदाम् among those skilled speech, श्रेष्ठ: excellent, राजा king, वैदेहम् addressing, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
translation: The king (Dasaratha), skilled in speech, accompanied by counsellors and kins said to Janaka,the lord of the Videhas:

text:
विदितं ते महाराज इक्ष्वाकुकुलदैवतम्।।1.70.16।।

वक्ता सर्वेषु कृत्येषु वसिष्ठो भगवानृषि:।
meaning: महाराज O Great king, भगवान् venerable, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, इक्ष्वाकुकुलदैवतम् spiritual protector of Ikshvaku race, सर्वेषु in all, कृत्येषु ceremonies, वक्ता spokesman, ते to you, विदितम् is known.
translation: "O Great king venerable Vasishta is the spiritual protector of the Ikshvakus race and it is known that for all ceremonies he is our spokesman".

text:
विश्वामित्राभ्यनुज्ञातस्सह सर्वैर्महर्षिभि:।।1.70.17।।

एष वक्ष्यति धर्मात्मा वसिष्ठो मे यथाक्रमम्।
meaning: सर्वै: by all, महर्षिभि: सह along with maharshis, विश्वामित्राभ्यनुज्ञात: having been permitted by Visvamitra, धर्मात्मा virtuous, एष: वसिष्ठ: this Vasishta, यथाक्रमम् in detailed order, मे my (race), वक्ष्यति will tell you.
translation: "Having been permitted by Viswamitra, along with all maharshis virtuous Vasishta will tell you in detail about my race".

text:
एवमुक्त्वा नरश्रेष्ठे राज्ञां मध्ये महात्मनाम्।।1.70.18।।

तूष्णींभूते दशरथे वसिष्ठो भगवानृषि:।

उवाच वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञो वैदेहं सपुरोधसम्।।1.70.19।।
meaning: नरश्रेष्ठे when the best among men, दशरथे Dasaratha, महात्मनाम् of the distinguished, राज्ञाम् kings, मध्ये amidst, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, तूष्णींभूते remained silent, वाक्यज्ञ: wellversed in speech, भगवान् adorable, वसिष्ठ: ऋषिः Vasishta, सपुरोधसम् in the company of priests, वैदेहम् Janaka, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.
translation:
Having said this amidst the best of men and the most distinguished among kings, Dasaratha remained silent. Then Vasishta, the venerable sage, wellversed in speech
spoke to the Lord of Videhas (Janaka) in the midst of priests.

text:
एवमुक्त्वा नरश्रेष्ठे राज्ञां मध्ये महात्मनाम्।।1.70.18।।

तूष्णींभूते दशरथे वसिष्ठो भगवानृषि:।

उवाच वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञो वैदेहं सपुरोधसम्।।1.70.19।।
meaning: नरश्रेष्ठे when the best among men, दशरथे Dasaratha, महात्मनाम् of the distinguished, राज्ञाम् kings, मध्ये amidst, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, तूष्णींभूते remained silent, वाक्यज्ञ: wellversed in speech, भगवान् adorable, वसिष्ठ: ऋषिः Vasishta, सपुरोधसम् in the company of priests, वैदेहम् Janaka, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.
translation:
Having said this amidst the best of men and the most distinguished among kings, Dasaratha remained silent. Then Vasishta, the venerable sage, wellversed in speech
spoke to the Lord of Videhas (Janaka) in the midst of priests.

text:
अव्यक्तप्रभवो ब्रह्मा शाश्वतो नित्य अव्यय:।

तस्मान्मरीचि स्संजज्ञे मरीचे: काश्यप: सुत:।।1.70.20।।
meaning: अव्यक्तप्रभव: the unmanifest, शाश्वत: eternal, नित्य: constant, अव्यय: Imperishable, ब्रह्मा Brahma, तस्मात् from him, मरीचि: Marichi, संजज्ञे was born, मरीचे: from Marichi, काश्यप: Kasyapa, सुत: son (sprang).
translation: "From the unmanifest was born the eternal, the constant, the imperishable Brahma. To him was born Marichi and to Marichi, Kasyapa.

text:
विवस्वान् काश्यपाज्जज्ञे मनुर्वैवस्वत स्स्मृत:।

मनु: प्रजापति: पूर्वमिक्ष्वाकुस्तु मनोस्सुत:।।1.70.21।।
meaning: काश्यपात् from Kasyapa, विवस्वान् Vivasvan, जज्ञे was begotten, वैवस्वत: as Vivasvata, मनु: Manu, स्मृत: said, मनु: Manu, पूर्वम् formerly, प्रजापति: prajapati, इक्ष्वाकु: Ikshavaku, मनो: Manu's, सुत: son.
translation:
Kasyapa begot Vivasvan and Vivasvan, Manu. Ikshavaku was the son of Manu
otherwise called Prajapati or Vaivasvata.

text:
तमिक्ष्वाकुमयोध्यायां राजानं विद्धि पूर्वकम्।

इक्ष्वाकोस्तु सुतश्श्रीमान् कुक्षिरित्येव विश्रुत:।।1.70.22।।
meaning: तम् इक्ष्वाकुम् him as Ikshvaku, अयोध्यायाम् in the city of Ayodhya, पूर्वकम् राजानम् ancestral king, विद्धि be informed, श्रीमान् the glorious, कुक्षिरित्येव known as Kukshi, विश्रुत: wellknown, इक्ष्वाको: Ikshvaku's, सुत: son(was born).
translation: It may be noted that Ikshvaku was the first ancestral king of Ayodhya whose son was the wellknown, glorious Kukshi.

text:
कुक्षेरथात्मज: श्रीमान् विकुक्षिरुदपद्यत।

विकुक्षेस्तु महातेजा बाण: पुत्र: प्रतापवान्।।1.70.23।।
meaning: अथ thereafter, कुक्षे: Kushi's, श्रीमान् prosperous, विकुक्षि: Vikushi, आत्मज: as son, उदपद्यत was born, महातेजा: highly lustrous, प्रतापवान् valourous, बाण: Bana, विकुक्षे: Vikushi's, पुत्र: son.
translation: Prosperous Vikukshi was Kukshi's son, who brought forth brilliant and powerful Bana.

text:
बाणस्य तु महातेजा अनरण्य: प्रतापवान्।

अनरण्यात्पृथुर्जज्ञे त्रिशङ्कुस्तु पृथोस्सुत:।।1.70.24।।
meaning: महातेजा: highly splendrous, प्रतापवान् valourous, अनरण्य: Anaranya, बाणस्य Bana's, अनरण्यात् from Anaranya, पृथु: Pruthu, जज्ञे born, त्रिशङ्कु: तु Trishanku, पृथो Pruthu's, सुत: son.
translation: Bana's son was the most brilliant and valiant Anaranya whose son Pruthu was succeeded by Trisanku.

text:
त्रिशङ्कोरभवत्पुत्रो दुन्दुमारो महायशा:।

युवनाश्वसुतस्त्वासीन्मान्धाता पृथिवीपति:।।1.70.25।।
meaning: त्रिशङ्को: of Trishanku, महायशा: highly famous, दुन्दुमार: Dundumara, पुत्र: अभवत् born as a son, मान्धाता known as Mandhata, पृथिवीपति: king, युवनाश्वसुत: son of Yuvanashva, आसीत् was born.
translation: Trisanku's famous son was Dundumara also known as Yuvanashva whose son was king Mandhata.

text:
मान्धातुस्तु सुत श्श्रीमान् सुसन्धिरुदपद्यत।

सुसन्धेरपि पुत्रौ द्वौ ध्रुवसन्धि: प्रसेनजित्।।1.70.26।।
meaning: मान्धातु: for Mandhata, सुसन्धि: Susandhi, श्रीमान् venerable, उदपद्यत was born, सुसन्धेरपि for Susandhi, ध्रुवसन्धि: Dhruvasandhi, प्रसेनजित् Prasenajit, द्वौ two, पुत्रौ sons.
translation: Mandhata's son was prosperous Susandhi who brought forth two sons Dhruvasandhi and Prasenajit.

text:
यशस्वी ध्रुवसन्धेस्तु भरतो नाम नामत:।

भरतात्तु महातेजा असितो नाम जातवान्।।1.70.27।।
meaning: ध्रुवसन्धे: तु for Dhruvasandhi, नामत: by name, भरत: नाम known Bharata, यशस्वी illustrious, भरतात् from Bharata, महातेजा: highly vigoruos, असितो नाम named Asita, जातवान् begot.
translation: To Dhruvasandhi was born the wellknown Bharata who begot the vigorous Asita.

text:
यस्यैते प्रतिराजान उदपद्यन्त शत्रव:।

हैहयास्तालजंघाश्च शूराश्च शशिबिन्दव:।।1.70.28।।
meaning: यस्य for Asita, हैहया: Haihayas, तालजंघाश्च Talajanghas, शूरा: valiant men, शशिबिन्दवश्च Sasibindus, एते प्रतिराजान: kings fighting against him, शत्रव: enemies, उदपद्यन्त arose.
translation: Valiant kings belonging to the races of the Haihayas, Talaiangha, and Sasibindus became the enemies to Asita.

text:
तांस्तु स प्रतियुध्यन् वै युद्धे राजा प्रवासित:।

हिमवन्तमुपागम्य भृगुप्रस्रवणेऽवसत्।।1.70.29।।

असितोऽल्पबलो राजा मन्त्रिभिस्सहितस्तदा।
meaning: स: राजा that king, तान् them, युद्धे in the conflict, प्रतियुध्यन् fighting against them, प्रवासित: was exiled from his kingdom, राजा असित: king Asita, अल्पबल: with relatively lesser strength, मन्त्रिभि: with counsellors, सहित: accompanied, तदा then, हिमवन्तम् towards Himavat mountain, उपागम्य having reached, भृगुप्रस्रवणे in a place known as Bhriguprasravana, अवसत् lived.
translation: The king Asita who was a weakling was defeated in the conflict against the kings and was exiled. Along with his counsellors he lived at on the Bhriguprasravana Himavat mountain.

text:
द्वे चास्य भार्ये गर्भिण्यौ बभूवतुरिति श्रुतम्।।1.70.30।।

एका गर्भविनाशाय सपत्न्यै सगरं ददौ।
meaning: अस्य his, द्वे two, भार्ये wives, गर्भिण्यौ pregnant, बभूवतु: became, इति thus, श्रुतम् is known, एका one, गर्भविनाशाय to destroy the embryo, सपत्नयै the other wife, सगरम् poison mixed in food, ददौ gave.
translation: It is said that his (Asita's) two wives were pregnant. One gave food mixed with poison to the other with the intention of destroying her embryo.

text:
तत श्शैलवरं रम्यं बभूवाभिरतो मुनि:।।1.70.31।।

भार्गवश्च्यवनो नाम हिमवन्तमुपाश्रित:।
meaning: तत: afterwards, रम्यम् delightful, शैलवरम् best of mountains, अभिरत: relished, भार्गव: of the family of Bhrigu, च्यवनो नाम named Chyavana, हिमवन्तम् Himavt, उपाश्रित: has taken refuge.
translation: At that time Chyavana of the family of Bhrigu liked to stay at Himavat, the great, pleasant mountain.

text:
तत्रैका तु महाभागा भार्गवं देववर्चसम्।।1.70.32।।

ववन्दे पद्मपत्राक्षी काङ्क्षन्ती सुतमात्मन:।
meaning: महाभागा highly accomplished, तत्र (तयो:) एका one of those two, पद्मपत्राक्षी lotuseyed, आत्मन: for her, सुतम् son, काङ्क्षन्ती desiring, देववर्चसम् resembling the lustre of devatas, भार्गवम् Chyavana, ववन्दे offered salutations.
translation:
That the lotuseyed and highly accomplished Kalindi, offered herself for a son to
Chyavana who was glowing like a god.

text:
तमृषिं साऽभ्युपागम्य कालिंदी चाभ्यवादयत्।।1.70.33।।

स तामभ्यवदद्विप्र: पुत्रेप्सुं पुत्रजन्मनि।
meaning: सा that, कालिंदी च Kalindi also, तम् that, ऋषिम् ascetic, अभ्युपागम्य after approaching, अभ्यवादयत् paid obeisance, स: that, विप्र: brahmin, ताम् her, पुत्रेप्सुम् desiring son, पुत्रजन्मनि concerning the birth of a son to her, अभ्यवदत् spoke.
translation: Having approached the ascetic. Kalindi paid obeisance to him who said:

text:
तव कुक्षौ महाभागे सुपुत्रस्सुमहाबल:।।1.70.34।।

महावीर्यो महातेजा अचिरात्सञ्जनिष्यति।

गरेण सहित श्श्रीमान् मा शुच: कमलेक्षणे।।1.70.35।।
meaning: महाभागे O Prosperous one, तव your, कुक्षौ in womb, सुमहाबल: having great prowess, महातेजा: highly lustrous, सुपुत्र: virtuous child, श्रीमान् glorious, गरेण with poison, सहित: furnished, अचिरात् in a short time, सञ्जनिष्यति will be born, कमलेक्षणे O Lotus eyedone, मा शुच: do not grieve.
translation: 'O Great lady a child of high prowess, lustre and virtues is growing in your womb. In a short time this glorious son carrying with him the poison (administered to you) will be born. O Lotuseyed lady, do not grieve'.

text:
तव कुक्षौ महाभागे सुपुत्रस्सुमहाबल:।।1.70.34।।

महावीर्यो महातेजा अचिरात्सञ्जनिष्यति।

गरेण सहित श्श्रीमान् मा शुच: कमलेक्षणे।।1.70.35।।
meaning: महाभागे O Prosperous one, तव your, कुक्षौ in womb, सुमहाबल: having great prowess, महातेजा: highly lustrous, सुपुत्र: virtuous child, श्रीमान् glorious, गरेण with poison, सहित: furnished, अचिरात् in a short time, सञ्जनिष्यति will be born, कमलेक्षणे O Lotus eyedone, मा शुच: do not grieve.
translation: 'O Great lady a child of high prowess, lustre and virtues is growing in your womb. In a short time this glorious son carrying with him the poison (administered to you) will be born. O Lotuseyed lady, do not grieve'.

text:
च्यवनं तु नमस्कृत्य राजपुत्री पतिव्रता।

पतिशोकातुरा तस्मात्पुत्रं देवी व्यजायत।।1.70.36।।
meaning: राजपुत्री princess, पतिव्रता chaste and virtuous one, पतिशोकातुरा afflicted with the sorrow due to loss of her husband, देवी that eldest queen, च्यवनम् Chyavana, नमस्कृत्य having saluted him, तस्मात् for that husband, पुत्रम् son, व्यजायत gave birth.
translation:
This eldest queen who was a devoted wife, afflicted with sorrow due to loss of her
husband gave birth to a son by the grace of Chyavana.

text:
सपत्न्या तु गरस्तस्यै दत्तो गर्भजिघांसया।

सह तेन गरेणैव जात: स सगरोऽभवत्।।1.70.37।।
meaning: सपत्न्या by her rival queen, तस्यै for her, गर्भजिघांसया with the intention of destroying embryo, गर: poison, दत्त: was given, तेन by that, गरेण सह एव with poison itself, जात: was born, स: that, सगर: sagara, अभवत् became.
translation: Since poison was given to her by her rival queen with the intention of destroying the embryo, the son was born with poison and so came to be known as Sagara.

text:
सगरस्यासमञ्जस्तु असमञ्जात्तथांऽशुमान्।

दिलीपोंऽशुमत: पुत्रो दिलीपस्य भगीरथ:।।1.70.38।।
meaning: असमञ्ज: Asamanjasa, सगरस्य Sagara's, तथा also, असमञ्जात् from Asamanja, अंशुमान् Anshuman, दिलीप: Dilipa, अंशुमत: Anshuman's, पुत्र: son, भगीरथ: Bhagiratha, दिलीपस्य Dilipa's (son).
translation: Asamanja was the son of Sagara and to him was born Anshuman. Dilipa was the son of Anshuman and father of Bhagiratha.

text:
भगीरथात्ककुत्स्थश्च ककुत्स्थस्य रघुस्सुत:।

रघोस्तु पुत्रस्तेजस्वी प्रवृद्ध: पुरुषादक:।।1.70.39।।

कल्माषपादो ह्यभवत्तस्माज्जातस्तु शंखण:।
meaning: भगीरथात् from Bhagiratha, ककुत्स्थ: Kakutsthsa, रघु: Raghu, ककुत्स्थस्य Kakutsthsa's, सुत: son, तेजस्वी powerful, प्रवृद्ध: Pravriddha, रघो: Raghu's, पुत्र: son, पुरुषादक: Purushadaka, कल्माषपाद: Kalmashapada, अभवत् became, तस्मात् for him, शंखण: Samkhana, जात: was born.
translation: Bhagiratha begot Kakustha whose son was Raghu. Powerful Pravriddha was Raghu's son. He became Purushadaka (cannibal), on the curse of Vasistha. He grasped water in order to retaliate Vasishta but was prevented by his wife. The water fell on his feet and he came to be known as Kalmashapada (feet polluted with water). Samkhana was born to him.

text:
सुदर्शन: शङ्घणस्य अग्निवर्ण स्सुदर्शनात्।।1.70.40।।

शीघ्रगस्त्वग्निवर्णस्य शीघ्रगस्य मरु स्सुत:।

मरो: प्रशुश्रुकस्त्वासीदम्बरीष: प्रशुश्रृकात्।।1.70.41।।
meaning: शङ्घणस्य for Samkhana, सुदर्शन: Sudarsana, सुदर्शनात् from Sudarsana, अग्निवर्ण: Agnivarna, अग्निवर्णस्य for AgniVarna, शीघ्रग: Sighraga, शीघ्रगस्य for sighraga, मरु: Maru, सुत: son, मरो: for Maru, प्रशुश्रुक: Prasusruka, प्रशुश्रुकात् from Prasusukra, अम्बरीष: Ambarisha, आसीत् were born.
translation: Sudarsana was the son of Samkhana. His son was Agnivarna. To Agnivarna was born Sighraga and to Sighraga, Maru. To Maru, was born Prasusruka and to Prasrusuka, Ambarisha.

text:
सुदर्शन: शङ्घणस्य अग्निवर्ण स्सुदर्शनात्।।1.70.40।।

शीघ्रगस्त्वग्निवर्णस्य शीघ्रगस्य मरु स्सुत:।

मरो: प्रशुश्रुकस्त्वासीदम्बरीष: प्रशुश्रृकात्।।1.70.41।।
meaning: शङ्घणस्य for Samkhana, सुदर्शन: Sudarsana, सुदर्शनात् from Sudarsana, अग्निवर्ण: Agnivarna, अग्निवर्णस्य for AgniVarna, शीघ्रग: Sighraga, शीघ्रगस्य for sighraga, मरु: Maru, सुत: son, मरो: for Maru, प्रशुश्रुक: Prasusruka, प्रशुश्रुकात् from Prasusukra, अम्बरीष: Ambarisha, आसीत् were born.
translation: Sudarsana was the son of Samkhana. His son was Agnivarna. To Agnivarna was born Sighraga and to Sighraga, Maru. To Maru, was born Prasusruka and to Prasrusuka, Ambarisha.

text:
अम्बरीषस्य पुत्रोऽभून्नहुष: पृथिवीपति:।

नहुषस्य ययातिस्तु नाभागस्तु ययातिज:।।1.70.42।।
meaning: पृथिवीपति: king, नहुष: Nahusha, अम्बरीषस्य Ambarisha's, पुत्र: son, अभूत् became, नहुषस्य Nahusha's, ययाति: Yayati was born, नाभाग: Nabhaga , ययातिज: was born to Yayati.
translation: King Nahusha was the son of Ambarisha. To Nahusha was born Yayati whose son was Nabhaga.

text:
नाभागस्य बभूवाज: अजाद्दशरथोऽभवत्।

अस्माद्दशरथाज्जातौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।1.70.43।।
meaning: नाभागस्य Nabhaga's, अज: Aja, बभूव was born, अजात् from Aja, दशरथ: Dasaratha, अभवत् was born, अस्मात् from this, दशरथात् from Dasaratha, भ्रातरौ brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, जातौ were born.
translation: Nabhaga's son was Aja. Aja was the father of Dasaratha and Dasaratha, the father of Rama and Lakshmana.
